intro: Mercurialis annua var. huetii, commonly known as the Huet's annual mercury, is a variant of the common mercury plant. It is a flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae, characterized by its upright growth habit and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typical of the genus Mercurialis. It is native to southern Europe and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its botanical features make it a distinctive species within the Mercurialis genus.
